Dating: 18TH DYNASTY (not before); TUTHMOSIS IV/MENKHEPERURE ?; 18TH DYNASTY (not after)
Name: Stela of Amen-ehtef
Description: In the lunette is a winged sun disc and an udjat-eye. To the left Osiris is seated on a block throne, holding a flagellum (nekhakha-sceptre), a was-sceptre and crook (heqa-sceptre). In front of him is a richly laden offering table and an adoring couple. The texts are incised above or in front of the figures. The central register shows two seated couples on chairs in front of low offering tables. In front of the left couple is a male libationer, in front of the right couple a female one. The texts were added above the figures. The lower part of the stela has three lines of text with the offering formula.
